alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Interior Seward Peninsula; Kivalina and Red Dog Dock; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Yukon Delta Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 05 at 3:59AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Unsettled Weather for the West Coast Through Saturday... A cold low originating from Siberia will bring in a series of strong frontal-low pressure systems into the West Coast beginning today. A front moves in tonight and Wednesday with heavy snow squalls and gale force west-southwest winds at times. Areas around Kotzebue Sound to Kivalina will see easterly gusts to 45 mph and blowing snow. Snow amounts will range from 2 to 5 inches, heaviest for the southern Seward Peninsula, from Tuesday through Thursday. Then snow squalls will develop with heavy bursts of snow and gusty winds from the west which will begin Wednesday afternoon from the Seward Peninsula south. Winds will shift to the north-northwest Wednesday night and snow squalls will continue at times south of the Seward Peninsula through this weekend. Snow squalls are notorious for bringing quick bursts of heavy snow and strong winds which will reduce visibilty to 1/2 mile or less at times resulting in difficult travel conditions. Stay tuned for the latest updates at weather.gov/afg
